content: @Aman Agrawal (amanagr) hey what are your views on adding a padding to the username in the private message. As the username and all the options(all message, mentions are in same line). screencapture-chat-zulip-org-1614252772093.png
This doesn't stand out to me as something we should do.
It's not clear to me what changed here.
He shifted the user names to right.

I think that sort of indentation there could be helpful for consistency with how we do topics within a stream. We'd want to be careful to (A) not break the vertical alignment of unread counts and (B) think about whether the cost in terms of forcing us to truncate long names (especially for group PMs) is worth it.

@Tim Abbott hey I checked it and does not affect the vertical alignment of unread counts .And about truncating the long name is not a problem because only some of the user have a very long name. screencapture-localhost-9991-1614333849994.png

I'm mildly against this change. I understand the rationale, but it doesn't really look better visually to me, and I think you can argue that it makes as much sense to line up PM circles with PM hashes as it does PM names with topic names. And the tiebreaker for me is that we would be truncating names.
Closed the PR. Thanks for proposing this @Ritik ☠️! Proposals like this are valuable work even when we decide not to do them.
